Xevion's Rise: The Victory of a Garu
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Library: Fan Fiction, Poetry, Birthday List, Links & Non-Fiction Archive: Poetry: Xevion's Rise: The Victory of a Garu
By Iron_Datu on Saturday, August 14, 2004 - 07:07 am:

Xevion's Rise: The Victory of a Garu

Out of infernal Kawrea’s obsidian night
strode Xevion the destroyer-Nemesis of light
his dread minions fell back at his baneful sight
“Today”, he bellowed, “we set loose our blight!”

The horde- a raging maelstrom of teeth and nails,
barreled forth in a flurry of fur and scales
eager to rend and wreck the hated world above
with sinews charged by Xevion’s twisted love

As Xevion and the black tides surged to Kawrea’s maw
Up ahead they beheld a Garu with one upraised paw
“Ho ho” he called, “Where do you uglies go?”
“Bravely turn back or face me as your foe!”

Xevion choked vitriol at the Garu’s effrontery
his bellow was deafening and burst an artery
“Foolish slave beast to step in my path!”
“All stand back! I shall show him my wrath!”

Answered the Garu, “Please do show away
and be quick about it I haven’t all day!”
“Unleash it forthwith, don’t talk me to death!
Oh by the way, you have monstrous breath!”

Xevion retorted in a manner most deadly and dire
He spewed out a gout, nay, a tornado of fire.
Trees turned to ash, the earth was blasted bare
when the horde dared peek, the Garu was nowhere.

Xevion was startled by the whisper in his ear
“Ooh ya got me… I am wounded I fear…”
“Ho ho, you are slow! Big and and dumb too!
You lack the finesse to touch this handsome Garu!”

Bouncing on Xevion’s befuddled mien
the Garu carved a Picasso with his fangs keen
His fired up fist and bright blazing kick
Made Xevion wish he had called to work sick

Pummeled on the left and battered on the right
Xevion let loose with all his pyrokinetic might
The world turned molten ablaze with white fires
The horde had turned into a field of pyres!


Yet through the flames danced a lone flitting shape
Could it be? Is it brave and dashing Pipo the ape?
Of course not, dear reader, without much ado
It was the wonderful springy red headed Garu!

“Oops would be the word for that display,
you seem to have run out of guts I should say!”
With that the Garu around Xevion he ran,
Faster than any pixie, mogi or Zan!

Up went Xevion in a whirling wind to the sky
Startling a Raiducken who chanced to go by
His dark heart for once quivered with fear
as he shot out beyond the stratosphere

The Garu watched as the dark speck disappeared
He sighed at his tail that was slightly seared
“Gosh” he thought “it’s off to the vet..”
and with that bravely jaunted into the sunset.
